p: Chloroquine (CQ) and hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) are used to treat mainly malaria and rheumatic diseases, respectively and have a very similar chemical structure [ 122]. CQ showed to be able to inhibit MERS-CoV in vitro in a dose-dependent manner. [ 123, 124]. In addition, to MERS-CoV, no clinical data are available on the success of chloroquine to patients [ 125].
